comments.body: This may be caused by EUCA-11907.
[~tony], was this seen on an automated setup? Was the property configuration retried? Can you point me to the setup?
[~shaon] is checking if this is related to EUCA-11907.

Looks like it's related to EUCA-11907. Restarted eucalyptus-cloud after adding {{eucalyptus-guava-14-compat-1.0.0.jar}} file.

{{storage}} service became enabled and was able to create volume/snapshot.
However the {{<cluster>.storage.vservername}} property is still missing in the euctl output, and not set. Should we assume that this property is not required anymore?
[~swathi], could you conform that the property in question is no longer needed?

[~vasya] I'm not aware of any property changes in the NetApp backend. EUCA-11907 will prevent the SC from going to ENABLED state but should not mess with configurable property {{<cluster>.storage.vservername}}. If the SC is backed by NetApp cluster mode configuring this property is mandatory. Will work with [~shaon] to investigate this further

Update - SC in question is backed by NetApp 7 mode, not Cluster mode. All NetApp related configurable properties are missing in euctl output, not just {{vservername}}. EBS operations on the cloud are currently working because the interaction with 7-mode does not require {{vservername}} and SC has assumed defaults for the rest of the configurable properties. Regardless of NetApp mode, [all related properties|https://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/#admin-guide/configure_advanced_storage_netapp_properties.html] should be available after the blockstoragemanager is set to netapp. Database record backing the configurable properties is present but the properties don't show up in euctl output. Will need to investigate the missing properties further

{noformat}
eucalyptus_shared=# select * from netapp_info; 
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version | netapp_aggregate | auto_snapshots | clone_retries | convert_ucode | create_ucode | dedup_policy | dedup_schedule | enable_autosize | 
enable_compression | enable_dedup | enable_inline_compression | enable_space_reservation | fractional_reserve | guarantee | initiator_os_type | lun_name | lun_os_type | storage_name | no_atime_update | no_snap | parent_flex_volume | portset | snap_percent | snap_sched_d
ays | snap_sched_hours | snap_sched_weeks | snapshot_policy |  try_first  | use_largest_aggregate | autosize_increment_mb | autosize_max_multiplier | vserver_name 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+------------------+----------------+---------------+---------------+--------------+--------------+----------------+-----------------+-
-------------------+--------------+---------------------------+--------------------------+--------------------+-----------+-------------------+----------+-------------+--------------+-----------------+---------+--------------------+---------+--------------+-------------
----+------------------+------------------+-----------------+-------------+-----------------------+-----------------------+-------------------------+--------------
 8aef85cd54caceee0154cad0be4c0002 | 2016-05-19 13:59:18.476 | 2016-05-19 13:59:18.476 | 28705fac-6bcf-448e-a151-dac754f3200f |       0 |                  | f              |           600 | on            | on           |              |                | t               | 
f                  | f            | f                         | t                        |                  0 | volume    | linux             | lun1     | linux       | one          | on              | on      |                    |         |            0 |             
  0 |                0 |                0 | none            | volume_grow | t                     |                   256 |                       3 | 
(1 row)
{noformat}
The property is visible on the cloud controller, but not on the ufs host. I think if we want the property to be visible on the ufs we'd need to install the san rpm on that host.
[~sjones], this is good point. I'd think we need to have SAN specific libs in SC only. I'd not install them on UFS just to have properties.

[~sjones], I executed euctl from the CLC and still don't see the property. I was under the impression that output for euctl is computed by the CLC since the database lives on the CLC and returned to the requestor, isn't that accurate? 

{noformat}

[~vasya], SAN libs are installed both on the CLC and the SC. SAN jar on the other hand is installed only on the SC. SAN specific jars are not needed on the UFS up until 4.2.2, has anything changed in 4.3?

[~swathi], you can specify the endpoint to use as follows:

{code}
#
# euctl one.storage.vservername
#
#
# euctl -U http://localhost:8773/services/Properties one.storage.vservername
one.storage.vservername = 
#
#
{code}
This issue may be addressed due to changes for EUCA-12926.
[~shaon], could you verify that this is still an issue after EUCA-12926 was resolved?

This doesn't seem to be an issue anymore, the property is available and can be modified,
